work.author: Abbo of Fleury
work.title: Sententia Abbonis de differentia circuli et sperae
De ratione sphere
work.incipit: Studiosis astrologie primo sciendum est per geometricam quid distat inter circulum et speram
work.explicit: Si vero nota est aliquis planetarum est.
work.note: Description of the heavens - universe is a sphere with earth in the centre; there are ten circles - five parallels, two colures, the Milky way, the horizon, and the zodiac. Explains the evagations of planets, their colours, motions etc. Diagram.
work.bibl: Thomson, Ron B. “Two Astronomical Tractates of Abbo of Fleury.” In The Light of Nature. Essays in the History and Philosophy of Science Presented to A.C. Crombie, edited by J.D. North and J.J. Roche, 113–33. Dordrecht: Springer, 1985.

work.title: Apuleian sphere

work.title: The Collatio Alexandri et Dindimi
work.summary: Consists of five fictive letters (three by Alexander, two answers from Dindimus, king of the Brahmans of India. Was probably originally written in Greek, although no Greek text has survived. According to Ross the two other Alexander texts, the Epitome and the Epistola, were intended to appear together, while the Collatio was added to them later. The Collatio was regarded as a useful tract on the ascetic like and so makes a frequent appearance in collection of moral and religious character (p. 128). Judging by the growing number of manuscripts from the twelfth century onwards shows that the interest in the texts was growing presenting the Indians as good pagans par excellence in the later Middle Ages (p. 278).
work.incipit: Sepe ad aures meas fando peruenit rationem uitae
work.explicit: quia donata repudias, aut invidiae, quod a meliore praestantur.
work.bibl: Pritchard, T. "The Collatio Alexandri et Dindimi: A Revised Text," Classica et Mediaevalia 46 (): 255-283 (not using this manuscript).
Steinmann, M. "Die Collatio Alexandri et Dindimi – eine annotierte Arbeitsbibliographie," Göttinger Forum für Altertumswissenschaft 4 (2001) 51-84
Cary, G. "A Note on the Medieval History of the Collatio Alexandri cum Dindimo," Classica et Mediaevalia, 15 (1954): 124-9.
Ross, D. J. A. "A Check-list of MSS of Three Alexander Texts: The Julius Valerius Epitome, the Epistola ad Aristotelem and the Collatio cum Dindimo" Scriptorium 10 (1956): 127-132.

work.note: Text divided in twelve section for each zodiacal sign; the explanation for the names of the twelve zones are not mythological. Then on the name of constellations based on Isidore, Etym. III, 71 (De nominibus stellarum); reproach to these fabulis mendacissimis foedicissimisque.

work.title: In quo signo versetur mars
work.incipit: In quo signo uersetur Mars: annis ab initio mundi per senarium divisis et annorum hunc numerum excedentium mensibus
work.explicit: Sin autem prima partitio duodenario concludatur, in Virgine memoratum semper inueniri planetam.
work.bibl: David Juste, "Neither Observation nor Astronomical Tables: An Alternative Way of Computing the Planetary Longitudes in the Early Western Middle Ages," in Studies in the History of the Exact Sciences in Honour of David Pingree, Leiden-Boston, MA 2004, pp. 181-222, with editioin in the appendix (pp. 216-217).
Entry in Mirabile.
work.note: The work offers a method to calculate the longitude of the five planets without the need of observation or manipulation of astronomical tables. Since one knew the position of the planets during the Creation, one needed just to calculate the time elapsed since Creation and do the neccessary multiplication.

work.author: (Ps.) Bede
work.title: Opusculum Itaque stella veneris et mercurii
work.incipit: Itaque stella veneris et mercurii hoc a superioribus tribus planetarum stellis differunt
work.explicit: sed quia ulteriores et idcirco longiores aetheris metas peragat.
work.bibl: Bede. Opera Didascalica. Edited by Charles Jones. CCSL, 123 C. Turnhout: Brepols, 1980. P. 658.
Clavis, 2323a.
Thorndike-Kibre 797.7.

work.author: (Ps.) Bede
work.title: De apsidibus planetarum
work.incipit: Circulus zodiacus qui XII signis constat omni ex parte aeque vicinus est terrae
work.explicit: Et VIIma ut tamen decies revolutus non LXXX sed potius LXX dierum numerum reddat.
work.bibl: Bede. Opera Didascalica. Edited by Charles Jones. CCSL, 123 C. Turnhout: Brepols, 1980. P. 659.

work.title: Argumentum ad inveniendam XIIII lunam

work.explicit: debes reliquium per septenos multiplicare.
work.bibl: Bede. Opera Didascalica. Edited by Charles Jones. CCSL, 123 C. Turnhout: Brepols, 1980. P. 659.

work.incipit: Reverentissimo ac sanctissimo fratri VVichtedo presbytero, Beda optabilem in domino salutem

work.author: Helpericus Altissiodorensis
work.title: Liber de computo
work.incipit: Domino Patri sanctissimo, nomine Aspro, moribus autem placidissimo, Helpericus humilis (Praefatio)
Cum fratribus adolescentioribus nostris quaedam calculatoriae artis rudimenta communi sermone explicare coepissem (Prologus)
Annus solaris ut majorum constat solertia investigatum (Cap. I)
work.explicit: alphabeti characteribus inducti, illa deinceps facilius assequantur.
work.bibl: Borst, Kalenderreform, p. 323-24.

work.title: Martyrologium
work.author: Wandalbert von Prüm
work.note: Consists of one opening letter (Praefatio) addressed to Otrich and the text of the martyrologium.
work.incipit: Domino Otrio Wandalbertus salutem dicit. Veteri et perantiquo praecepto monemur
Dies 1 Primum nunc Iani vocitatum nomine mensem

work.title: Prayer
work.quote: Domine deus omnipotens sancta trinitas et indiuisa unitas Domine pater qui per unigenitum filium tuum dominum nostrum ihesum christum totum coaeternum et aequalem in substantia diuinitatis, in unitate et uirtute spiritus sancti omnia condidisti, et tempore nouissimo per eundem incarnatum totum mundum reformasti, presta domine ut tua misericordia inspirante per apertionem illam qua sensus apostolorum post resurrectionem aperuisti de uolubilitate firmamenti et stellarum astrorumque cursu secundum modulum nostrae fragilitatis capere et aliis ministrare ualeamus. per eundem dominum.

work.title: On the creation of the luminaries according to the bible
work.quote: Sancta scriptura nobis a deo per beatum moysen tradita docet deum in quarto die luminaria duo solem uidelicet lunamque per uerbum sicut omnia creauit fecisse luminare maius ut preesset et diei et luminare minus nocti ut preesset nocti.

work.author: Pliny the Elder
work.title: De positione et cursu septem planetarum (Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. V, 3)
work.incipit: Inter caelum et terram certis discreta spatiis semptem sidera pendent
work.explicit: Dein morata in coitu solis biduo cum tardissime a tricesima luce ad easdem vices exit.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. II.
work.bibl: Eastwood, Bruce, and Gerd Graßhoff. "Planetary Diagrams for Roman Astronomy in Medieval Europe, Ca. 800-1500." Transactions of the American Philosophical Society 94, no. 3 (2004): I-158, here 22-27.
Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1260-63.

work.author: Pliny the Elder
work.title: De intervallis earum (Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. V, 4)
work.incipit: Intervalla eorum a terra multi indagare temptarunt
work.explicit: Ita septem tonis effici quam diapason armoniam vocant.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. II.
work.bibl: Eastwood, Bruce, and Gerd Graßhoff. "Planetary Diagrams for Roman Astronomy in Medieval Europe, Ca. 800-1500." Transactions of the American Philosophical Society 94, no. 3 (2004): I-158, here 27-30.
Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1263-65.

work.author: Pliny the Elder
work.title: De absidibus earum (Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. V, 5)
work.incipit: Tres autem quas supras solem diximus sitas
work.explicit: sicut in rotis radios ut subiecta figura demonstrat.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. II.
work.bibl: Eastwood, Bruce, and Gerd Graßhoff. "Planetary Diagrams for Roman Astronomy in Medieval Europe, Ca. 800-1500." Transactions of the American Philosophical Society 94, no. 3 (2004): I-158, here 30-35.
Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1265-69.

work.author: Pliny the Elder
work.title: De cursu earum per zodiacum circulum (Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. V, 6)
work.incipit: Cur autem magnitudines suas et colores mutent
work.explicit: Sed inter omnia haec sidera martis maxime inobservabilis est cursus.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. II.
work.bibl: Eastwood, Bruce, and Gerd Graßhoff. "Planetary Diagrams for Roman Astronomy in Medieval Europe, Ca. 800-1500." Transactions of the American Philosophical Society 94, no. 3 (2004): I-158, here 35-40.
Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1270-1273.

work.author: Pliny the Elder
work.title: De presagiis tempestatum (Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. V, 12)
work.incipit: Etenim praedictis difficilioribus transire convenit ad reliqua tempestatum praesagia
work.explicit: sudorem repositoriis reliquentia diras tempestates praenuntiant.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. XVIII, ch. 340-65. Used also in Libri computi, V, 12.
work.bibl: Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1281-1293.

work.title: De temporum mutatione
work.incipit: Omnis ratio tempestatum observata est ab antiquis tribus modis
work.explicit: omnes hibernos fructus et praecones laedi necesse est.
work.note: Excerpt from Pliny's Historia naturalis, Lib. XVIII, ch. 220-25, 275-77.
work.bibl: Borst, Schriften, Vol. 3, pp. 1443-.

work.author: Ptolemy
work.title: Preceptum canonis Ptolomei
work.bibl: David Juste, ‘MS London, British Library, Harley 2506’ (update: 08.12.2017), Ptolemaeus Arabus et Latinus. Manuscripts.

work.author: Herigerus Lobiensis
work.title: Regulae de numerorum abaci rationibus
work.bibl: Bubnov 1899, pp. 8-22.

work.author: Iuvenalis
work.title: Saturae
work.bibl: Munk Olsen, L’ étude 4,2, p. 119.

work.title: De ratione conputandi (Scottus Rat.)
work.bibl: Maura Walsh, and Dáibhí Ó Cróinín (ed). Cummian’s Letter De controversia paschali, together with a related Irish computistical tract De ratione conputandi. Toronto: Pontifical Institute of Medieval Studies, 1988.
work.note: Borst ( Borst, Kalenderreform, pp. 177-189.) suggested that this work was written around 650 in South Ireland. It was intended not only for monastic, but for general use - a manual for all Latin readers including clerics. On calendar and arithmetical questions followed Victorius of Aquitaine and Dionysius. For the theme on language borrowed heavily from Isidore. The manual is divided in two parts: 1) comprising 62 chapters mainly on the solar calendar with a catalogue of time units; 2) comprising 53 chapters - the course of the moon and its significance for the Easter calculation.

work.title: Scholia Basileensia
work.incipit: Quaeritur quare ab Ioue coepit et non a musis ut Homerus
work.explicit: Effusum est lac et facta est circuli albi species.
work.bibl: Dell’Era, Antonio. "Gli Scholia Basileensia a Germanico," in Atti Della Accademia Nazionale Dei Lincei: Memorie, Classe di Scienze morali, storiche e filologiche. Ser. VIII, vol. XXIII. Romе, 1979, pp. 301-379.

work.title: Scholia Strozziana
work.incipit: Caelum circulis V distinguitur, quorum II extremi maxime frigide, australi humilimus et aquilonius excelsissimus
work.explicit: Immo et ceteri pisces, sed hi tantum apparent, quia exiliunt, ceteri in imo gurgitis descendunt.
work.bibl: Dell’Era, Antonio. "Una miscellanea astronomica medievale: gli "Scholia Strozziana" a germanico," in Atti Della Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei: Memorie, Classe di Scienze morali, storiche e filologiche. Ser. VIII, vol. XXIII. Romе, 1979, pp. 147-267.

work.title: Somnium Scipionis

work.incipit: Cum in africam venissem M. Manilio consuli ad quartam legionem tribunus
work.explicit: Ille discessit; ego somno solutus sum.
